Standing Firm
CRITICISM of what has been
called the militant attitude of this
paper has been made by prominent
undergraduates engaged in campus
activities. This paper has been
charged with unfairness, with being
disrespectful, and with not voicing
the opinion of the campus. On
what bases these accusations have
been made we do not know. Doubtless, there have been no editorials
published to which any basically
sound and unprejudiced objection
can be made. What has been set
forth in this paper has been our
sincere and firm convictions. We
refuse to back down.
This paper does not claim that
it voices the opinion of the campus.
\Ve are determined to mould the
campus opinion; to set forth what
we see best for the undergraduate
department of the University. But
if the general opinion of the student
hody is shown definitely to be contrary to our views on pertinent
campus matters we will be willing
to reconsider our policy, As it is
now, we feel that there is no unified
campus opinion and, as a newspaper, we feel it our duty to
crystallize a positive opinion.
